data.title: A person with such ambitions is incorrigible in respect to the tiresome, revolting character of money.
data.meta_description: Halldor Laxness's quote captures the essence of an individual driven by grand aspirations, someone who remains unyielding in their pursuit of success, despite the distasteful nature of money. This quote symbolizes a mindset that is immune to the corrupting influence of material wealth, emphasizing the individual's unwavering commitment to their ambitions and ideals. It suggests that those with exceptional aspirations see money not as an end in itself but as a means to an end, valuing the impact they can make through their accomplishments rather than the accumulating wealth. Laxness's words highlight the resolute determination and moral compass of these individuals, who remain undeterred by the shallow allure of money and instead focus on leaving a lasting mark on the world.

Quotes Interpret

Halldor Laxness's quote captures the essence of an individual driven by grand aspirations, someone who remains unyielding in their pursuit of success, despite the distasteful nature of money. This quote symbolizes a mindset that is immune to the corrupting influence of material wealth, emphasizing the individual's unwavering commitment to their ambitions and ideals. It suggests that those with exceptional aspirations see money not as an end in itself but as a means to an end, valuing the impact they can make through their accomplishments rather than the accumulating wealth. Laxness's words highlight the resolute determination and moral compass of these individuals, who remain undeterred by the shallow allure of money and instead focus on leaving a lasting mark on the world.
